creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
The URI syntax for embedding literal IPv6 address given in RFC2732 does not seem
to be supported by the URI parser.   This at least prevents correct WebDAV
operation in httpd 2.0 when a DAV client uses a literal IPv6 address, since
Destination and If headers can contain such URIs.  An example request which is
rejected with a 400 error:

PUT /dav/a HTTP/1.1
Host: [feed::1]:8080
Content-Length: 2370
If: <http://[feed::1]:8080/dav/a>
(<opaquelocktoken:3a3ba8e5-d11d-b211-b761-f100f74bf002>)

IPv6 literal address support was added today to apr_uri_parse(), 
apr_uri_unparse(), and apr_uri_parse_hostinfo()

Thanks for your report!
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Only just got round to testing these changes - they work perfectly, of course :)
My DAV server test suite passes fine with a HEAD-ish server using a URL like
http://[feed::1]:8080/dav/

Great stuff, thanks!
